oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cavalry sword and scabard
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: CSA cavalry sword and scabard that belonged to Jacob Cruse of Lincoln County, Tennessee. Cruse enlisted at George's Store on April 29, 1861. He served until April 27, 1862, and was discharged. Cruse re-enlisted on April 29, 1863, as a private in Cpt. John Jackson's cavalry in Forrest's escort. He was wounded on September 19, 1863, at Chickam and died a few days later.
